result.execSummary:
The defendant Tommy L. McAbee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges; Drug Surcharge (both counts).
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Spend 1yr in the county jail, commencing 2/13/16.  Huber privileges are allowed.  Credit for 342 days served.  No association with known felons.  No driving without valid license.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges are allowed.  Credit for 342 days served.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.

superMiscConds.notes: ALL UNPAID COURT COSTS ARE STILL DUE.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Alcohol / drug.  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  CONCURRENT to Ct.1.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney A Komp. Clerk/H. Barnett. On ct 1 the court imposes a total sentence of 10 years WSP:  5 years initial confinement w/credit for 492 days served; 5 years extended supervision w/conditions; on ct 2 the court imposes a total sentence of 10 years WSP, concurent to ct 1:  5 years initial confinement w/credit for 492 days served; 5 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for SAP; deft is not eligible for CIP.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Brett Ekes.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 4 years w/conditions on each count concurrent.  Court orders 1 year conditional jail w/ huber.  Credit for 342 days.  Court costs, drug surcharge & DNA surcharge ordered on each count.  Appeal rights given.
With Atty Ekes and by approval of the court, the SEH of 2/1/16 at 2:30pm is rescheduled, as he just received the PSI and needs time to go over with deft; reset to 2/3/16 at 2:30pm.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney B Ekes.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 3 is dismissed and read in; on cts 1 & 2 the State dismisses the enhancer "on or near a school".  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1 & 2.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 2.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 2/1/16 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.
